name: All About Blood Quiz | Human Body | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following blood cells actually carry the oxygen to your cells?
questions.explanation:
Red blood cells.

	They use hemoglobin to do this.

questions.text: Which of the following blood cells fight infection?
questions.explanation:
White blood cells.

	There are several varieties of white blood cells, each doing a different job.

questions.text: Which of the following assist in clotting wounds?
questions.explanation:
Platelets.

	Without properly-functioning platelets, your blood will not clot - a disorder known as hemophilia.

questions.text: What is the liquid portion of the blood called?
questions.explanation:
Plasma.

	It is clear and yellowish.

questions.text: How is a bird's blood different from a human's?
questions.correct: The red blood cells of birds have a nucleus
options: Birds do not have any white blood cells
Birds have spherical red blood cells
The platelets of birds are more efficient
questions.explanation:
The red blood cells of birds have a nucleus.

	In mammals, red blood cells are the only cells without nuclei.

questions.text: What molecule in the blood carries oxygen?
questions.explanation:
Hemoglobin.

	Iron is used to manufacture hemoglobin, which is why iron-deficient people are anemic.

True.

	Even insects and worms have blood!

questions.text: This African tribe traditionally lives on a diet that includes cow blood- taken straight from the still-living cow.
questions.explanation:
Masai.

	This is obtained by firing a short arrow into the jugular vein of the cow. The blood is usually mixed with milk.

questions.text: In the United States, it is highly unlikely to catch any bloodborne diseases by donating blood, if proper procedure is adhered to.
questions.explanation:
True.

	You can't usually catch a disease from donating blood in the United States if proper procedure is followed. New sterile equipment is used each time.

questions.text: What is the most common blood type?
questions.explanation:
O positive.

	Type O positve is the most common. About 38 percent of the population has this type.

questions.text: Someone has type A positive blood. What are they positive for?
questions.explanation:
Rh factor.

	Someone who is positive has the Rh factor in their blood.

Rhesus incompatibility factor.

	It is named after the rhesus monkey.

questions.text: Why is the Rh factor important?
questions.correct: It can lead to harm in unborn fetuses
options: It is an indicator of susceptability to cancer
It indicates that the donor has an infection
questions.explanation:
It can lead to harm in unborn fetuses.

	If an Rh negative woman has an Rh positive fetus, her cells may attack the baby's. The danger grows with subsequent pregnancies.

questions.text: What is the least common of the ABO blood types?
questions.explanation:
AB.

	AB is the least common blood type. Less than 3 percent of the general population have it. However, it is much more common in some ethnic groups.
